verses.text: 不可分派結黨弟兄們，我從前對你們說話，還不能把你們看作屬靈的人，只能看作屬肉體的人，看作在基督裡的嬰孩。

words.note: Refers to dividing into partisan groups.
Often used with 分派, implying creating divisive groups.
Lit. 'younger and older brother'.
Verb-object compound: 'speak words'.

words.definition: to regard as, to consider as

words.note: Lit. 'belonging to the spirit'.

words.definition: to regard as, to consider as

words.note: Lit. 'belonging to the fleshly body'.

words.definition: to regard as, to consider as

verses.text: 我餵給你們吃的是奶，不是飯，因為那時你們不能吃，就是現在還是不能，
因為你們仍然是屬肉體的。在你們當中既然有嫉妒紛爭，你們不還是屬肉體，照著世人的方式而行嗎？

words.note: Lit. 'belonging to the fleshly body'.
Lit. 'belonging to the fleshly body'.
Refers to those living without spiritual understanding.

verses.text: 有人說「我是保羅派的」，又有人說「我是亞波羅派的」，你們不是和世人一樣嗎？

words.note: Refers to followers of Paul.
Refers to followers of Apollos.
Refers to those living without spiritual understanding.

verses.text: 亞波羅算甚麼？保羅算甚麼？我們不過是　神的僕人，你們藉著我們信了主；按著主所賜給各人的，

words.note: The elevated space indicates reverence for God.
Often precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase.

verses.text: 我栽種了，亞波羅澆灌了，唯有　神使它生長。

words.note: Preceded by a revered space in Chinese Bible typesetting.

verses.text: 所以，栽種的算不得甚麼，澆灌的也算不得甚麼，只在乎那使它生長的　神。

words.note: Turns the verb '栽種' into 'the one who plants'.
Turns the verb '澆灌' into 'the one who waters'.

words.definition: to depend on, to care about

words.note: Connects '使它生長' as a modifier to '神'.
Preceded by a revered space in Chinese Bible typesetting.

verses.text: 栽種的和澆灌的都是一樣，只是各人要照著自己的勞苦得著自己的報酬。
我們是　神的同工，你們是　神的田地，　神的房屋。

words.note: Preceded by a revered space in Chinese Bible typesetting.
Preceded by a revered space in Chinese Bible typesetting.
Preceded by a revered space in Chinese Bible typesetting.

verses.text: 我照著　神賜給我的恩典，就像一個聰明的工程師，立好了根基，別人在上面建造。各人要注意怎樣在上面建造，

words.note: Preceded by a revered space in Chinese Bible typesetting.

verses.text: 因為除了那已經立好的根基以外，沒有人能立別的根基。那根基就是耶穌基督。

words.note: Verb with resultative complement '好'.
Often used metaphorically for spiritual foundation.
Often used metaphorically for spiritual foundation.
Often used metaphorically for spiritual foundation.

verses.text: 如果有人用金、銀、寶石、草、木、禾稭，在這根基上建造，

words.note: Refers to dried stalks, often used in biblical imagery.
Often used metaphorically for spiritual foundation.
Positional suffix indicating 'on top of'.

verses.text: 各人的工程將來必要顯露，因為那日子必把它顯明出來。有火要把它顯露出來，那火要考驗各人的工程是怎樣的。

words.note: Refers to the result of one's labor or actions.
Often used in more formal or emphatic contexts.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
Directional complement indicating movement outwards or appearance.
Modal verb indicating intention or future action.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
Directional complement indicating movement outwards or appearance.
Modal verb indicating intention or future action.
Refers to the result of one's labor or actions.
Used here to form an adjectival phrase.

verses.text: 如果有人在這根基上建造的工程存得住，他就要得到賞賜；

words.note: Often used metaphorically for spiritual foundation.
Positional suffix indicating 'on top of'.
Refers to the result of one's labor or actions.
Verb with a potential complement indicating ability to remain stable.
Modal verb indicating intention or future action.

verses.text: 如果有人的工程被燒毀，他就要受虧損；自己卻要得救，只是要像從火裡經過一樣。

words.note: Refers to the result of one's labor or actions.
Indicates a passive voice construction.
Modal verb indicating intention or future action.
Indicates a turn or contrast.
Modal verb indicating intention or future action.
A core concept in Christianity meaning 'to be delivered from sin'.
Modal verb indicating intention or future action.
Positional suffix indicating 'inside'.
Often used with 像 (xiàng) to mean 'like... the same way'.

verses.text: 難道不知道你們是　神的殿，　神的靈住在你們裡面嗎？

words.definition: Is it possible that...?; Don't tell me...
words.note: Used to form rhetorical questions.
Capitalized for reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Capitalized for reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 如果有人毀壞　神的殿，　神必要毀壞這人，因為　神的殿是聖潔的，這殿就是你們。

words.note: Capitalized for reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Capitalized for reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Capitalized for reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 誰也不要自欺。如果你們當中有人以為自己在這世代裡是有智慧的，他就應該變為愚笨，好讓他有智慧。

words.note: Used for negative imperative.
Often used after '在' with nouns.

verses.text: 因為這世界的智慧，在　神看來是愚笨的，如經上所記：「他使有智慧的人中了自己的詭計。」

words.note: Capitalized for reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Indicates the following verb is the object of a preceding verb or noun.
Combines with '人' to mean 'those who have wisdom'.
Pronounced 'zhòng' when meaning 'to hit/suffer'.

verses.text: 又說：「主知道智慧人的意念是虛妄的。」

words.note: Often capitalized as a title for God/Christ.

verses.text: 所以，誰都不可拿人來誇耀，因為一切都是你們的。

words.note: Often paired with 誰 for 'anyone at all'
Indicates purpose, similar to 'in order to'

verses.text: 無論是保羅，是亞波羅，是磯法，是世界，是生，是死，是現在的事，是將來的事，都是你們的。

words.note: Part of '無論是...是...' structure

verses.text: 你們是屬基督的，基督是屬　神的。

words.definition: to belong to, be subordinate to

words.note: Here implies 'those who belong to'

words.definition: to belong to, be subordinate to

words.note: The preceding blank space indicates reverence for God.
Here implies 'He who belongs to'
